com.sap.cloud.sdk.datamodel.odata.helper

Interface FluentHelperCustomHttpHeader<CallerT>

  • Type Parameters:
    CallerT - The return type of the terminating methods. Usually this is the type of the FluentHelperBasic implementation that this helper was called on.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CollectionValuedFluentHelperFunction, FluentHelperBasic, FluentHelperByKey, FluentHelperCreate, FluentHelperDelete, FluentHelperFunction, FluentHelperModification, FluentHelperRead, FluentHelperUpdate, SingleValuedFluentHelperFunction
    Deprecated. 
    This type is deprecated. All headers explicitly added for the request will also be used for the optional CSRF token retrieval. A request for metadata is not happening any longer, when using recommended method FluentHelperBasic.executeRequest(HttpDestinationProperties).

    @Deprecated
public interface FluentHelperCustomHttpHeader<CallerT>
    Helper class to provide a fluent interface to specify custom header for an operation. Sample Usage (from a FluentHelperBasic named service): 
     service.withHeader("Some Key", "Some Value").and("Another Key", "Another value").onRequestOnly().execute()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FluentHelperCustomHttpHeader<CallerT> and(String headerName, String headerValue)
      Deprecated. 
      Use FluentHelperBasic.withHeader(String, String) instead.
      CallerT onRequestAndImplicitRequests()
      Deprecated. 
      Headers will be always applied for both: explicit and implicit request. The distinction between actual request and CSRF token request has been dropped. Use only FluentHelperBasic.withHeader(String, String) or FluentHelperBasic.withHeaders(Map).
      CallerT onRequestOnly()
      Deprecated. 
      Headers will be always applied for both: explicit and implicit request. The distinction between actual request and CSRF token request has been dropped. Use only FluentHelperBasic.withHeader(String, String) or FluentHelperBasic.withHeaders(Map).

    • Method Detail

      • and

        @Nonnull
 @Deprecated
FluentHelperCustomHttpHeader<CallerT> and(@Nonnull
                                                                String headerName,
                                                                @Nullable
                                                                String headerValue)
        Deprecated. Use FluentHelperBasic.withHeader(String, String) instead.
        Add an additional custom header pair to be used as a custom header. This can be used to give multiple headers to the same terminating method.
        Parameters:
        headerName - The header name to add.
        headerValue - The header value to add.
        Returns:
        This FluentHelper to provide a fluent API.

      • onRequestAndImplicitRequests

        @Nonnull
 @Deprecated
CallerT onRequestAndImplicitRequests()
        Deprecated. Headers will be always applied for both: explicit and implicit request. The distinction between actual request and CSRF token request has been dropped. Use only FluentHelperBasic.withHeader(String, String) or FluentHelperBasic.withHeaders(Map).
        Adds the given header/value pairs to all requests, so for example CSRF token and metadata fetches, as well as the actual request to execute.
        Returns:
        The original fluent helper that called this fluent helper.

      • onRequestOnly

        @Nonnull
 @Deprecated
CallerT onRequestOnly()
        Deprecated. Headers will be always applied for both: explicit and implicit request. The distinction between actual request and CSRF token request has been dropped. Use only FluentHelperBasic.withHeader(String, String) or FluentHelperBasic.withHeaders(Map).
        Adds the given header/value pairs only to the actual request to execute. These headers are not part of the implicit requests like CSRF token and metadata fetches.
        Returns:
        The original fluent helper that called this fluent helper.
